 The maximum number of cameras.
#define MAR_CAM_NO_CAMERA   255
 A constant which can be used to initialize camera IDs to specify no camera.

 V4L2 Memory Mapped Devices.
#define MAR_CAM_FMT_YUYV   0x01
 YUYV/YUY2 FourCC Pixel Format.

Detailed Description

Contains camera interfacing code for the MAR library.

Author:
Greg Eddington

mar_error_code mar_camera_free ( mar_camera_id  id  ) 

Frees a camera created by the MAR library.

Parameters:
id The ID of the camera to free
Returns:
MAR_ERROR_NONE on success, an error code on failure

References mar_camera::camera, MAR_CAM_TYPE_V4L2_MMAP, and mar_v4l2_mmap_camera_free().

Referenced by mar_augment_free(), and mar_augment_init().

unsigned char* mar_camera_get_frame_buffer ( mar_camera_id  id  ) 

Returns the camera's frame buffer in an RGB24 format.

The frame buffer is 3 * width * height in size.

Parameters:
id The ID of the camera to get the frame buffer of.
Returns:
The camera frame buffer.

References MAR_CAM_TYPE_V4L2_MMAP, and mar_v4l2_mmap_camera_get_frame_buffer().

Referenced by mar_augment_get_camera_frame_buffer(), mar_augment_get_keypoints(), mar_augment_get_regions(), and mar_augment_update().

int *  width,
int *  height 
)

Returns the currently set camera resolution.

mar_camera_type  type,
char *  dev_name,
mar_camera_format  format,
int  width,
int  height 
)

Initializes a MAR camera.

Parameters:
id A pointer to an int which will be filled with the ID of the newly created camera
type The type of camera to create
dev_name The camera device name
format The camera pixel format
width The camera resolution width
height The camera resolution height
Returns:
MAR_ERROR_NONE on success, an error code on failure
